description: The Franciscans were among the reformed religious orders whose preaching and teaching activities helped revive the Roman Catholic Church in the Southern Netherlands following years of turmoil in the 1500s. Rubens here depicted the order’s founder, Saint Francis of Assisi, recognizable by the wound that imitates the pierced hands of the crucified Jesus. Rubens conveyed the saint’s spirituality through his meditative gaze and posture.
title: Saint Francis
